trans-unit.source: Use Chrome Postman with Azure Search | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Chrome Postman with Azure Search | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use Chrome Postman with Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: Use Chrome Postman with Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure Postman.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure Postman.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search index.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search index.

trans-unit.source: Post documents to and query the index with Postman.
trans-unit.target: Post documents to and query the index with Postman.

trans-unit.source: How to use Chrome Postman with Azure Search
trans-unit.target: How to use Chrome Postman with Azure Search

trans-unit.source: [Postman](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/postman-rest-client/fdmmgilgnpjigdojojpjoooidkmcomcm "Chrome Postman") is a tool provided as part of Google Chrome that allows developers to work efficiently with REST-based API services such as Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: [Postman](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/postman-rest-client/fdmmgilgnpjigdojojpjoooidkmcomcm "Chrome Postman") is a tool provided as part of Google Chrome that allows developers to work efficiently with REST-based API services such as Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: You can use Postman to quickly create and query your search indexes by sending API calls through Postman, without having to write any code.
trans-unit.target: You can use Postman to quickly create and query your search indexes by sending API calls through Postman, without having to write any code.

trans-unit.source: This approach is an efficient way to learn the API and try out new features.
trans-unit.target: This approach is an efficient way to learn the API and try out new features.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: You must have an Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: You must have an Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: As with any custom application that uses Azure Search, you will need the URL to your service, plus an admin `api-key` so that you can create the index.
trans-unit.target: As with any custom application that uses Azure Search, you will need the URL to your service, plus an admin `api-key` so that you can create the index.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to get the values for your search service, see [Create a service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to get the values for your search service, see [Create a service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: To install Postman
trans-unit.target: To install Postman

trans-unit.source: To download Postman, visit the [Google Chrome Store](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/postman-rest-client/fdmmgilgnpjigdojojpjoooidkmcomcm).
trans-unit.target: To download Postman, visit the [Google Chrome Store](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/postman-rest-client/fdmmgilgnpjigdojojpjoooidkmcomcm).

trans-unit.source: The link from this page allows you to download and install the REST client for Postman.
trans-unit.target: The link from this page allows you to download and install the REST client for Postman.

trans-unit.source: After it is installed, you can launch Postman from the Chrome App Launcher.
trans-unit.target: After it is installed, you can launch Postman from the Chrome App Launcher.

trans-unit.source: To configure Postman to query Azure Search
trans-unit.target: To configure Postman to query Azure Search

trans-unit.source: To configure Postman, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure Postman, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure Search service URL where it says "Enter request URL here".
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure Search service URL where it says "Enter request URL here".

trans-unit.source: Append to the URL: `?api-version=2015-02-28`.
trans-unit.target: Append to the URL: `?api-version=2015-02-28`.

trans-unit.source: You could also specify a different API version.
trans-unit.target: You could also specify a different API version.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Search service versioning](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Search service versioning](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for details.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that `GET` is chosen.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that `GET` is chosen.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Headers** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Headers** button.

trans-unit.source: Enter values for:
trans-unit.target: Enter values for:

trans-unit.source: `api-key`: [Admin Key]
trans-unit.target: `api-key`: [Admin Key]

trans-unit.source: `Content-Type`: `application/json; charset=utf-8`
trans-unit.target: `Content-Type`: `application/json; charset=utf-8`

trans-unit.source: Click **Send** to issue the REST call to Azure Search and display the JSON response.
trans-unit.target: Click **Send** to issue the REST call to Azure Search and display the JSON response.

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure Search index with Postman
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure Search index with Postman

trans-unit.source: Next, we will expand on what we completed in the last step by issuing a REST call to create a new Azure Search index.
trans-unit.target: Next, we will expand on what we completed in the last step by issuing a REST call to create a new Azure Search index.

trans-unit.source: Unlike the previous call, the index creation requires an HTTP PUT and a JSON document with the definition of the index schema.
trans-unit.target: Unlike the previous call, the index creation requires an HTTP PUT and a JSON document with the definition of the index schema.

trans-unit.source: For this sample, we are going to create an index that will store a list of hiking trails.
trans-unit.target: For this sample, we are going to create an index that will store a list of hiking trails.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Change the URL to: `https://[SEARCH SERVICE].search.windows.net/indexes/trails?api-version=2015-02-28` using your search service name.
trans-unit.target: Change the URL to: `https://[SEARCH SERVICE].search.windows.net/indexes/trails?api-version=2015-02-28` using your search service name.

trans-unit.source: Change the request type from `GET` to `PUT`.
trans-unit.target: Change the request type from `GET` to `PUT`.

trans-unit.source: In the RAW body content, enter the following JSON:
trans-unit.target: In the RAW body content, enter the following JSON:

trans-unit.source: Click **Send**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Send**.

trans-unit.source: To post documents to an Azure Search index with Postman
trans-unit.target: To post documents to an Azure Search index with Postman

trans-unit.source: Now that the index is created, we can load documents into it.
trans-unit.target: Now that the index is created, we can load documents into it.

trans-unit.source: To do this, we'll post a group of documents in a batch, using data for five trails from the United States Geological Survey (USGS) dataset:
trans-unit.target: To do this, we'll post a group of documents in a batch, using data for five trails from the United States Geological Survey (USGS) dataset:

trans-unit.source: Change the URL to: `https://[SEARCH SERVICE].windows.net/indexes/trails/docs/index?api-version=2015-02-28` using your search service name.
trans-unit.target: Change the URL to: `https://[SEARCH SERVICE].windows.net/indexes/trails/docs/index?api-version=2015-02-28` using your search service name.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the URL includes a path to the index you just created.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the URL includes a path to the index you just created.

trans-unit.source: Change the HTTP type to `POST`.
trans-unit.target: Change the HTTP type to `POST`.

trans-unit.source: In the RAW body content, enter the following JSON:
trans-unit.target: In the RAW body content, enter the following JSON:

trans-unit.source: Click **Send**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Send**.

trans-unit.source: To query the index with Postman
trans-unit.target: To query the index with Postman

trans-unit.source: The final step is to query the index and issue a simple full-text search request for the word *trail*.
trans-unit.target: The final step is to query the index and issue a simple full-text search request for the word *trail*.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following in the URL: `https://[SEARCH SERVICE].search.windows.net/indexes/trails/docs?api-version=2015-02-28&search=trail` using your search service name.
trans-unit.target: Enter the following in the URL: `https://[SEARCH SERVICE].search.windows.net/indexes/trails/docs?api-version=2015-02-28&search=trail` using your search service name.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the URL includes the `search` query parameter and a search term of *trail*.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the URL includes the `search` query parameter and a search term of *trail*.

trans-unit.source: Change the HTTP request type to `GET`.
trans-unit.target: Change the HTTP request type to `GET`.

trans-unit.source: Click **Send**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Send**.

trans-unit.source: In the response, you should see the JSON search results returned from Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: In the response, you should see the JSON search results returned from Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that we have walked through all the basics of using Azure Search with Postman, there are few things to help you with the next steps:
trans-unit.target: Now that we have walked through all the basics of using Azure Search with Postman, there are few things to help you with the next steps:

trans-unit.source: Postman supports `Collections`, which are a convenient way to save commonly issued requests.
trans-unit.target: Postman supports `Collections`, which are a convenient way to save commonly issued requests.

trans-unit.source: You can share collections with other people, to be issued in their own copy of Postman.
trans-unit.target: You can share collections with other people, to be issued in their own copy of Postman.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Search documentation, make sure to make note of the HTTP request type (`GET`, `PUT`, and so forth) associated with each call and change as appropriate in Postman.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Search documentation, make sure to make note of the HTTP request type (`GET`, `PUT`, and so forth) associated with each call and change as appropriate in Postman.

trans-unit.source: Documentation for the REST API can be found on [MSDN](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798935.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Documentation for the REST API can be found on [MSDN](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798935.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You can also visit the [Video and tutorial list](search-video-demo-tutorial-list.md) for more examples.
trans-unit.target: You can also visit the [Video and tutorial list](search-video-demo-tutorial-list.md) for more examples.
